sentences.sContent: ...it not only serves as crucial bridge to build trust and connection between two generations but also exerts a profound and subtle influence toward to children’s personal growth...

...What it does mean is that the book business will go through a transformation in the next decade or so more profound than any it has seen since Gutenberg introduced printing from moveable type in the 1450s...
...Perhaps the most profound changes will come when the five billion people worldwide who currently lack Internet access get online...
...It is my profound belief that not only do we all need nature...

...Campus plays a crucial role in educating the young generation and the consciousness of “green campus” will definitely produce a profound effect on students’ various environmental protection activities after their graduation...

synos.tran: 深厚的；意义深远的；渊博的

trans.tranOther: having a strong influence or effect
